definition: large-scale Chinese opera/Beijing opera/major dramatic production (movie, TV series etc)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The famous actor is now appearing in Hamlet at the Grand Theatre.
sentences.chinese: 這位名演員正在大戲院演出《哈姆雷特》。

sentences.english: This day, Fu-ho cinema was temporary off from our life.
sentences.chinese: 這天，福和大戲院他暫時從缺於我們的生活。

sentences.english: She plays at the National Theatre tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今晚她在國家大戲院演出。

sentences.english: I happened to pass by the Grand Theater and see the poster.
sentences.chinese: 我碰巧經過大戲院並看到海報。

sentences.english: Very difficult to imagine, plans these two major drama's direction is Lipi .
sentences.chinese: 很難想象，策劃這兩場大戲的導演均是裏皮。

sentences.english: The latest revival toured theatres and received critical acclaim.
sentences.chinese: 最近的復演在各大戲院巡迴演出，並獲得一致好評。

definition: opera (or role) involving much singing and action/(fig.) highlight/main feature/major activity
axis/principal axis (in mechanics, optics, botany etc)/main axle (of engine)
to extend New Year's greetings/to pay a New Year's visit
colored lantern (used at Lantern Festival 元宵節|元宵节)
to start sth new or original (idiom); to break a new path/to break fresh ground
to make a pilgrimage (to visit a holy site)/to go on a sightseeing tour
to beat the gong to open a performance
